message.content:
Step 1: Identify the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) from the income statement.
 • COGS = 14,600,000.00

Step 2: Determine the inventory balances from the balance sheet.
 • Beginning Inventory (Initial_amount) = 0.00
 • Ending Inventory (End_amount) = 9,100,000.00

Step 3: Calculate the average inventory.
 • Average Inventory = (Beginning Inventory + Ending Inventory) / 2
 • Average Inventory = (0 + 9,100,000.00) / 2 = 4,550,000.00

Step 4: Compute the Inventory Turnover Ratio.
 • Inventory Turnover Ratio = COGS / Average Inventory
 • Inventory Turnover Ratio = 14,600,000.00 / 4,550,000.00 ≈ 3.21

Final Answer in JSON format:
{
  "solution": {
    "Inventory Turnover Ratio": "3.21"
  }
}
